column4: could someone tell me how to fix:  "Can't connect to wireless, firmware missing" in maverick?
your wireless device is?
!register | G0di
Not sure, whatever comes standard in a Dell Inspiron 1501

open a terminal and type "lspci" (thats a lowercase L) hit enter.. and it will spit out your PCI devices, find your wireless device and let me know what ti is(do not paste the whole freaking out put in the channel)
give me a few minutes... I have to go find a keyboard to do this
unless there's an onscreen keyboard?
i dunno, maybe...
It's a long story, it's a wall mounted autoupdate photoframe
i see.
Actually it looks like ubuntu smart recognized the drivers were missing in System-Admin-Additional Drivers.
ok.. what driver is there for it?
Though when I did that... it says "system installarchives() failed"
Broadcom B43
Though it fails to install
yea... i take it it's nt connected to the internet
